senses.de: The taste of something, or the way it smells.
senses.ex: This ice cream has a rich vanilla flavour.

Tips.title: Sensory Experience
Tips.description: Relates to the senses, mainly taste and smell, which are subjective.
Tips.example: This curry has a fiery flavour.

Tips.title: Descriptive Imagery
Tips.description: Often used to describe food with vivid language that evokes imagery.
Tips.example: Her homemade salsa had a zesty flavour.

Tips.title: Cultural Significance
Tips.description: Flavours can be associated with cultural or regional dishes.
Tips.example: Traditional paella has a unique saffron flavour.

senses.ex: The book had a distinct flavour of mystery and intrigue.

Tips.title: Context Matters
Tips.description: The meaning changes based on what it's describing, like an event, book, or trend.
Tips.example: The festival had a traditional flavour.

Tips.title: Figurative Use
Tips.description: When not about taste, it's a figurative way to speak of the essence or atmosphere.
Tips.example: The movie has a vintage 80's flavour.

senses.de: To give a particular taste to something.
senses.ex: She flavoured the soup with fresh herbs.

Tips.title: Cooking Actions
Tips.description: Used as an action in cooking to enhance or change the taste of food.
Tips.example: Flavour the stew with garlic and rosemary.

Tips.title: Ingredient Highlight
Tips.description: Emphasizes a specific ingredient used to create the taste.
Tips.example: She flavoured the cake with lemon zest.

senses.de: A property of quarks that affects their role in particle physics.
senses.ex: There are six flavours of quarks: up, down, charm, strange, top, and bottom.

Tips.title: Scientific Context
Tips.description: In physics, it refers to a property, not taste; used in specialized or educational texts.
Tips.example: Researchers discussed the properties of quark flavours.

Tips.title: Technical Jargon
Tips.description: It's a term from a specific field, unfamiliar outside that context.
Tips.example: She explained the flavour of subatomic particles in her thesis.

Aroma.wordDefinition:
Aroma refers to the smell or fragrance of something, while flavour refers to the taste or combination of tastes. Aroma is applicable when describing the scent of things like perfumes, flowers, or food, while flavour is applicable when describing the taste of food or drinks.

For example, a cake might have a vanilla aroma, but its flavour could be a combination of sweet, buttery, and vanilla notes.

Bouquet.wordDefinition:
Bouquet refers to the smell of something, especially wine or flowers, while flavor refers to the taste of something. Bouquet is applicable when describing the aroma of wine or perfume, while flavor is applicable when describing the taste of food or drink.

Bouquet is about what something smells like, while flavor is about what something tastes like.

Essence.wordDefinition:
Essence refers to the fundamental nature or quality of something. It is applicable when describing the most important or basic part of something.

For example, the essence of a flower is its fragrance or the essential meaning of a poem.

Essence refers to the fundamental nature of something, while flavour refers to the distinct taste or smell of something, especially related to food or drinks.

Save.wordDefinition:
Flavour refers to the taste or smell of something, while the word save means to rescue or protect something.

Save, on the other hand, is used when there is a need to protect or rescue something. For example, you might have to save someone from drowning or save your computer files from being deleted.

Flavour refers to the taste or smell of something, while save means to rescue or protect something. They are both used in different contexts and have different meanings.

Season.wordDefinition:
The word 'flavor' relates to taste, whereas season refers to enhancing the taste of a dish using spices or herbs. Flavor is the overall sensation of taste perceived by the tongue.

Seasoning is adding salt, pepper, or other seasonings to a dish to enhance its flavor. In summary, flavor is what you sense when you eat, while seasoning is what you add to the food to create that flavor.

Tang.wordDefinition:
Tang is a strong, sharp and acidic taste or smell.

It can be described as a tartness or acidic bite. Tang is commonly associated with citrus fruits like lemons and oranges.

Flavour is the general taste of something while tang refers to a specific sharp, acidic taste or smell.

Flavour can be sweet, salty, bitter or sour while tang is usually associated with citrus fruits.

Taste.wordDefinition:
Flavor refers to the distinctive quality that a food or drink has, often related to its ingredients and seasoning. Taste refers to the way something feels in the mouth, including sweet, salty, sour, bitter, and umami.

So, flavor is a more general term, while taste refers specifically to the different sensations on the tongue. When you talk about the overall deliciousness of something, you might use the word flavor.

When you are describing the specific sensations you get when you taste something, you might use the word taste.

Zest.wordDefinition:
Flavour refers to the taste or essence of something, while zest refers to the outer part of a citrus fruit, which contains a strong, tangy flavor.

Flavour can describe the taste of anything, whereas zest is specifically related to the citrus fruit. People often use the zest to add flavor to dishes such as cakes, salads, and cocktails.

quotes.Text: I don't want to be the flavor, the passing thing that the girls scream at. I think that it's more important for me, honestly, that the guy who gets dragged to the show, you know, looks at his wife and says, thank you, that was great and tells his buddies.
quotes.Title: Canadian Musician
quotes.Name: Michael Buble

quotes.Text: I was never afraid of failure after that because, I think, coming that close to death you get kissed. With the years, the actual experience of course fades, but the flavor of it doesn't. I just had a real sense of what choice do I have but to live fully?
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Debra Winger

quotes.Text: All my characters have their own political thoughts of the world around. If it is not in the script, I put it into them so that they become rooted to the local flavour.
quotes.Title: Indian Politician
quotes.Name: Abhishek Banerjee

quotes.Text: For me, I'm not trying to be the flavor for everybody. But I'm just proud when people I respect or people that I want to be my fans are my fans.
quotes.Title: American Wrestler
quotes.Name: Matt Sydal

quotes.Text: I always had a lot of confidence in my work and the unique flavor I like to bring to my characters, but you know I'm not a huge dreamer.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Nick Offerman

quotes.Text: Life has a certain flavor for those who have fought and risked all that the sheltered and protected can never experience.
quotes.Title: English Philosopher
quotes.Name: John Stuart Mill

quotes.Text: I adore recipes that make use of one cut of meat or a whole animal to create a complex dish, loaded with flavour.
quotes.Title: Israeli Chef
quotes.Name: Yotam Ottolenghi

quotes.Text: I learned at a young age what chasing flavors meant, and I've been doing that my whole life.
quotes.Title: Ethiopian Chef
quotes.Name: Marcus Samuelsson

quotes.Text: Truth has rough flavours if we bite it through.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: George Eliot

quotes.Text: My whole life has a Jewish flavour.
quotes.Title: English Writer
quotes.Name: Patrick Marber
